title: Michael Watson hospitalised after attack in Chingford, east London | Metro News
text:
Ashitha Nagesh for Metro.co.uk Saturday 18 Feb 2017 8:06 pm Michael Watson MBE in 2014 (Picture: Getty Images) 
Former boxer Michael Watson MBE was hospitalised after a shocking attack while he was in his car. 
The athlete was driving in Chingford, east London, on Thursday night when someone smashed into his Volkswagen Golf. Horse gets stuck after trying to climb on top of her stable 
As his carer Lennard Ballack got out to look at the damage, he was sprayed with ammonia by a man in a white Mercedes with tinted windows. 
He was then punched to the floor, and the two attackers tried to pull Watson out of the Golf. It’s believed they were trying to steal it. 
However, Watson’s arm was caught in the seatbelt, and as the assailants drove away he was dragged along the street for 500 to 600 yards. 
The attackers, who had covered their faces with caps and had their hoods up, then abandoned the attempted robbery. Watson was put into a 40-day coma in 1991 (Picture: Getty Images) 
Both Watson and Ballack spent two nights in hospital with ‘graphic’ injuries. Shops will soon be able to refuse your round pounds 
‘The door flung open and one man went to our car and the other guy sprayed me with what I later found out was ammonia,’ Ballack said. 
‘I felt helpless because I was fighting for my life. Then I was hit on the head with something – I’ve got no idea what it was. 
‘The next thing I know was, the Mercedes trying to drive away and it tried running me over.’ Watson receiving his MBE in 2004 (Picture: PA) 
Ballack said he checked himself out of hospital, and that Watson was discharged earlier today. Quick-thinking schoolgirl takes photo of paedophile as he tries to abduct her 
Watson’s illustrious career was ended in 1991 when he was put into a 40-day coma by Chris Eubank. The incident left him with brain damage. 
He added: ‘From everything that I’ve seen with Michael – from his injuries and the suffering from his boxing career – this made everything we’ve gone through so far seem minor. 
‘I just wish I’d have been able to help Micahel, but I was fighting for my life and I just didn’t expect it at all.’ More
